text:
(1)
Farming in the Bronx: Vegetable gardens on the N.E. corner of Astor and Radcliff Avenues. In the background
is Public School No. 89, on Mace Avenue.
August 2, 1928

P. L. Sperr

(2)
An Italian garden and goats at Newman and Seward
Avenues.
July 30, 1928

P. L. Sperr

(3)
A garden between White Plains Road and Furman Avenue; ear E. 239th Street. The houses are on both sides of the
latter thoroughfare.
May 24, 1928

P. L. Sperr
title: Farming in the Bronx.
